author: Pavan Dahat
text:
Two Maoists were killed in an alleged encounter with the police in Bastar region of Chhattisgarh on Sunday.

According to SRP Kalluri, Inspector General of Police, Bastar range, a small contingent of the District Reserve Guard and the Special Task Force was dispatched by Sukma Superintendent of Police D. Srawan to Kistaram area on information provided by intelligence agencies about the presence of Maoists.

A fierce gunfight took place between the police and the Maoists near Vanjalvala village. The bodies of two Maoists were recovered from the spot.

The two have been identified as Dusra Dharma, president of the ‘Revolutionary People’s Committee’ and Vetti Raju, president of the Dankaranya Kisan Majdoor Sangh.
title: Two Maoists killed in Bastar
